questions.question: The ancient Celtic practice of carrying lit gourds has _______ the practice of carving and lighting jack o' lanterns.

choices.answer: A. destroyed
B. evolved into
C. replaced
D. updated

questions.question: Why did the ancient Celts leave food on their doorsteps?

choices.answer: A. to feed the poor
B. to provide snacks for local children
C. to ward off evil spirits
D. to welcome the spirit of winter

imageMetadata.altText: Contactless food delivery service concept. Paper bag with groceries delivered and left outside at entrance door.  Online shopping. Healthy fresh fruit and vegetables, zero waste, recyclable package.

questions.question: What can you infer about the ancient Celtic calendar from the information presented in the video?

choices.answer: A. it was based on the seasons
B. it was based on the phases of the moon
C. it was based on the movements of the stars
D. it contained 12 months of 30 days each

imageMetadata.altText: Beautiful Autumn Colours Are Seen Across Loch Lomond

questions.question: Which costume would most likely be worn by the ancient Celts?

choices.answer: A
B
C
D

questions.question: How did the Christian holiday of Halloween differ from the Celtic festival of Samhain?

choices.answer: A. Halloween celebrated saints; Samhain involved ghosts and goblins
B. Halloween had a big feast; Samhain was celebrated by fasting for a week
C. Halloween was in the U.K. only; Samhain was throughout the Roman empire
Halloween customs in Samhain festivals--but not the other way around.

imageMetadata.altText: Halloween gingerbread cookies in plate on wooden table

questions.question: The practice of "souling" was most similar to which of the following?

choices.answer: A. dressing up in costume
b. carrying a jack o' lantern
C. begging for money
D. warding off evil spirits

imageMetadata.altText: Rear view of three children wearing halloween costumes trick or treating

questions.question: Why did Halloween not become popular in America until the 19th century?

choices.answer: A. immigration from Scotland & Ireland boomed during the 19th century
B. American religious authorities banned Halloween until the 19th
C. few children lived past the age of 2 in America until the 19th century
D. there were no Celts in America until the 19th century

imageMetadata.altText: Halloween, autumn scene with pumpkins and candles.

questions.question: What can you conclude about the Catholic Church's attitude toward pagan religious festivals?

choices.answer: A. the church encouraged people to celebrate pagan festivals
B. the church discouraged people from celebrating pagan festivals
C. the church incorporated pagan rituals into its own rituals
D. the church ignored pagan festivals completely

questions.question: What did the Roman festival of the goddess Pomona have in common with the Celtic festival of Samhain?

choices.answer: A. they both honored the dead
B. they both celebrated the harvest
C. they were both approved by the Catholic Church
D. they were both celebrated mainly by children

imageMetadata.altText: Thanksgiving, fall or autumn greeting background with pumpkin

questions.question: How do you mend a broken jack o' lantern?

choices.answer: A. with skin grafts and years of vegetable therapy
B. it depends on the jack o' lantern's health insurance
C. with gum and pre-chewed circus peanuts
D. with a pumpkin patch
